title: Why Brutalism Divided Opinion
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Brutalism Divided Opinion.

hook.text: Brutalist buildings are massive raw concrete structures that people either worship or want demolished. No middle ground.

buildup.text: The style emerged in the 1950s from Le Corbusier's raw concrete (bÃ©ton brut) experiments. It spread to public housing.

discovery.text: Governments loved brutalism because concrete was cheap, fast, and could house thousands. It felt democratic and honest.

twist.text: Residents hated the cold, stained surfaces. Concrete ages poorly, and water streaks turned utopian dreams into dystopia.

punchline.text: Concrete went from utopia to ruin to cool.
